intro: Viguiera sessilifolia, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces showy blue to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its foliage is typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. Viguiera sessilifolia is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
